etymology.description: Depicts a hand with emphasizing claws or fingernails -> borrowed phonetically to represent an earthly branch -> later developed meaning 'ugly' as simplified for 醜(醜) (chǒu, 'ugly').
etymology.interpretation: Originally representing a hand with claws, 丑(chǒu) was phonetically borrowed for unrelated meanings like 'earthly branch' and eventually adopted the meaning 'ugly' from 醜(醜) (chǒu, 'ugly').
etymology.simplification: 醜(醜) was simplified to 丑(chǒu), adopting the latter for its phonetic similarity.

examples.chinese: 这幅画看起来很丑(這幅畫看起來很丑)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè fú huà kàn qǐ lái hěn chǒu.

examples.chinese: 那个雕像做得很丑(那個雕像做得很丑)，引来路人的议论(引來路人的議論)。
examples.pinyin: Nà ge diāo xiàng zuò de hěn chǒu, yǐn lái lù rén de yì lùn.
examples.english: That statue is made very ugly, attracting the criticism of passersby.

examples.chinese: 天气炎热时(天氣炎熱時)，穿这件丑衬衫更让人不舒服(穿這件醜襯衫更讓人不舒服)。
examples.pinyin: Tiān qì yán rè shí, chuān zhè jiàn chǒu chèn shān gèng ràng rén bù shū fu.
examples.english: When the weather is hot, wearing this ugly shirt makes people even more uncomfortable.
